## What is Machine Learning?

Machine Learning enables computers to learn patterns from data without being explicitly programmed.

slides.title: Types of Machine Learning
slides.content:
# Types of ML ğŸ“Š

## Supervised Learning
- Labeled data (input + output)
- Classification: Predict categories
- Regression: Predict numbers

## Unsupervised Learning
- No labels
- Clustering: Group similar items
- Dimensionality reduction

## Reinforcement Learning
- Learn from environment
- Actions and rewards
- Games, robotics

| Type | Data | Example |
|------|------|--------|
| Supervised | Labeled | Spam detection |
| Unsupervised | Unlabeled | Customer segments |
| Reinforcement | Rewards | Game AI |

slides.title: Key Concepts
slides.content:
# Key ML Concepts ğŸ¯

## Bias-Variance Tradeoff
- High bias = underfitting
- High variance = overfitting
- Balance is key

## Train/Test Split
- Train on one set
- Test on held-out data
- Typical: 80/20 split

## Cross-Validation
- Multiple train/test splits
- More robust evaluation

## Overfitting
- Model memorizes training data
- Poor on new data

## Underfitting
- Model too simple
- Poor on all data

> ğŸ’¡ Good ML = generalization, not memorization!
